title: The General Problem
alt: I find that when someone's taking time to do something right in the present, they're a perfectionist with no ability to prioritize, whereas when someone took time to do something right in the past, they're a master artisan of great foresight.
transcript:
[Cueball sits at a table, eating a meal.]
Cueball: Can you pass the salt?[Cueball pauses, a bite of food on his fork, silently.][Cueball still has fork in mid-air.]
Cueball: I said-
Off-screen person: I know! I'm developing a system to pass you arbitrary condiments.
Cueball: It's been 20 minutes!
Off-screen person: It'll save time in the long run!
